massacre.translation[0].definitions[0].d: when a lot of people are killed violently, especially people who cannot defend themselves
massacre.translation[0].definitions[0].e: the only survivor of the massacre
the massacre of several hundred pro-democracy demonstrators
massacre.translation[0].definitions[1].d: a very bad defeat in a game or competition
massacre.translation[1].definitions[0].d: to kill a lot of people or animals in a violent way, especially when they cannot defend themselves
massacre.translation[1].definitions[0].e: The army massacred more than 150 unarmed civilians.
Tens of thousands of dolphins and small whales are brutally massacred every year.
massacre.translation[1].definitions[1].d: to defeat someone very badly in a game, competition etc
massacre.translation[1].definitions[1].e: The Cougars massacred the Bucs last night, 38–7.
massacre.translation[1].definitions[2].d: to spoil part of a play, a song etc by performing it very badly
massacre.translation[1].definitions[2].e: Unfortunately, Jones absolutely massacres the role of Ophelia.
